snippet: Charlotte and Eric Kaufman became the focus of a debate over parenting after they took their daughters — ages 1 and 3 — on a trip across the South Pacific that ended with a Navy rescue.
abstract: Charlotte and Eric Kaufman have become focus of raging debate over responsible parenting after taking their two tots--ages 1 and 3--on sailboat trip from Mexico to New Zealand that ended with United States Navy, Coast Guard and National Guard rescue; some critics suggest authorities should take their children away, while supporters say they were doing right thing by following their passion and involving their children early.

byline.contributor: Kristina Rebelo contributed reporting from San Diego, and Jess Bidgood from Boston.

lead_paragraph: Charlotte and Eric Kaufman became the focus of a debate over parenting after they took their daughters — ages 1 and 3 — on a trip across the South Pacific that ended with a Navy rescue.

headline.main: 2 Tots, a Sailboat and a Storm Over Parenting
headline.print_headline: 2 Tots, a Sailboat and a Storm Over Parenting
